class.name: ElitisticListPopulation

javadoc.text: Population of chromosomes which uses elitism (certain percentage of the best * chromosomes is directly copied to the next generation).
percentage of chromosomes copied to the next generation

javadoc.param: chromosomes list of chromosomes in the population
populationLimit maximal size of the population
elitismRate how many best chromosomes will be directly transferred to the next generation [in %]
javadoc.throws: NullArgumentException if the list of chromosomes is {@code null}
NotPositiveException if the population limit is not a positive number (< 1)
NumberIsTooLargeException if the list of chromosomes exceeds the population limit
OutOfRangeException if the elitism rate is outside the [0, 1] range

javadoc.text: Creates a new {@link ElitisticListPopulation} instance and initializes its inner chromosome list.
javadoc.param: populationLimit maximal size of the population
elitismRate how many best chromosomes will be directly transferred to the next generation [in %]
javadoc.throws: NotPositiveException if the population limit is not a positive number (< 1)
OutOfRangeException if the elitism rate is outside the [0, 1] range

javadoc.text: Start the population for the next generation. The {@link #elitismRate} * percents of the best chromosomes are directly copied to the next generation.
javadoc.return: the beginnings of the next generation.

method.name: nextGeneration
method.comment: initialize a new generation with the same parameters
index of the last "not good enough" chromosome

javadoc.text: Sets the elitism rate, i.e. how many best chromosomes will be directly transferred to the next generation [in %].
javadoc.param: elitismRate how many best chromosomes will be directly transferred to the next generation [in %]
javadoc.throws: OutOfRangeException if the elitism rate is outside the [0, 1] range
